Entries.default: "Shh! Keep your voices down, my cullies."
"Look alive!" Upon noticing you, one of the street urchins makes a hasty signal to his fellows.

"Hey! You've got no business here, so get on and go." 

A girl in filthy rags blocks your path and points a tiny dagger at you.
"What's going on here?"
"Get out of here, or I'll call the guards."
"No trouble intended. Farewell."
"We've got bellies to fill, but I'll cut yours open if it suits me, I will."
"Here. This is for buying food, not for eating."
[Attack] "No one threatens me, especially not some gutter rat!"
"Scram! This one's out for blood!" The urchins scramble - jumping from the pier and taking to the dirty water, emerging a few moments later on the far side of the canal.

"I know what to do with money, ass!" 

She hisses at you, but pauses as she catches sight of the coins. She takes them with a cautious sweep of her hand.
"Come on, cullies. This ought to get us something fresh for a change." She nods to you and waves her companion onward.

"You've never seen a hungry kid scamper, have you? We vanish like mice." 

She narrows her eyes, keeping the dagger pointed at your heart.
The girl steps back and watches you with wary attention.
"You best be off. I don't suppose the guards take kindly to scavenging."
"True enough. Everyone pocket what you have now." She gives you a neutral nod and gestures for the others to head out.

"Pst! Company." 

The ragged girl looks up at you again and makes a cautious signal to her group.
"Uh, he's not leaving..."
"Hope this makes things easier."
[Give her an egg.] "You probably need this more than I do."
"This'll fry up real nice in some lamprey oil." She accepts the egg with wide-eyed reverence.
"Careful around Queen's Berth. This place only looks clean 'cause it's paid for." She signals for the others to be off.
"Looks like it's eel instead of rats, my cullies!" She pockets her blade and accepts the coins with a grateful bow.
"You get out of here. I said it first."
"Someone's got to keep these weasels alive and fed." She nods toward her peers.
"You want something?"
